  • Field Details

    • state

      protected int state
      The local state of the stage. This state is different from the global state that is defined in model.

    • model

      protected Model model
      The parent model. Obviously, the model must be instantiated BEFORE the game stage.

    • name

      protected String name
      The name of the stage. It MUST correspond to the name registered in the StageFactory. It will be used by the factory to create an instance of the stage, by calling Model.startStage().

    • containers

      protected List<ContainerElement> containers
      The containers of the stage. Theses are mostly needed in board games. For games with sprites, it is most often useless to define containers.

    • elements

      protected List<GameElement> elements
      All elements composing the stage. It includes the containers.

    • selected

      protected List<GameElement> selected
      List of elements that are currently selected.

    • createElements

      public void createElements(StageElementsFactory elementsFactory)
      Create the elements of this stage thanks to a StageElementFactory This method is just a wrapper to call the setup() method of a StageElementsFactory. This method MUST NOT BE called directly. It is done by the controller when a stage must be set.
      Parameters:
      elementsFactory -
